intro: Calpocalyx sericea, commonly known as silky calpocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and showy, pink to lavender flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a drought-tolerant species. Its ornamental value and ecological benefits make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
